intro: Thapsia polygama var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has smooth, hairless stems and leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
